credit_line: Gift of Dr. Robert Erwin Jones, Class of 1952
title: William Penn's Signing a Treaty with the Indians in 1681
inscriptions: l.l. in plate: Benj.West pinxit.; l.c. in plate: John Boydell execudit 1775.; l.c. in plate: WILLIAM PENN's Treaty with the INDIANS, when he founded the PROVINCE OF PENSYLVANIA in NORTH AMERICA 1681./ To the Proprietaries of the Province of Pensylvania. Vc.Vc./ This PRINT, Engraved from the Original Painting belonging to the late Thomas Penn Esquire./ Published June 12th 1775 by JOHN BOYDELL   Engraver in Cheapside London.  Is respectfully Inscribed by Their obedient humble Servant.  JOHN BOYDELL; l.r. in plate: John Hall Sculpsit.; verso l.c. on sticker: [Toco Hill Framing, Atlanta, Ga.]
